intro: Alectra parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant has small, opposite, ovate leaves and produces clusters of tiny, pink to purple flowers. It typically grows in open, disturbed soils and is often found in tundra and alpine habitats. Alectra parvifolia is adapted to cold climates and has a short growing season.
